intro: Hieracium lamprophyllum subsp. mendiolanum, commonly known as the Mendola hawkweed, is a perennial herb native to southern Europe. It typically grows in open habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils. The plant features basal rosettes of broadly lanceolate leaves with a hairy surface. It produces yellow composite flowers arranged in a single head, which are visited by various pollinators. This subspecies is characterized by its distinctive leaf morphology and is often found in calcareous environments.
